title: I just won as Udyr jg and it makes me want to quit LoL.
body:
Dear Riot Games,
   I won a ranked game today (plat 3 mmr) and it left a bad/familiar taste in my mouth. I was Udyr vs a jungle Leona. My team played terribly early: ignored Leona's telegraphed pathing and even the wards she was walking through, dying to her ganks repeatedly. However, as a duelist jungler I was able to take every crab  and invade her because the lane comps were favorable. Eventually I was taking all her camps and warding her jg freely because she couldn't really stop it. We won and it was boring.

   The enemy team PLAYED BETTER but lost because we PICKED "BETTER" CHAMPS.

   I play this game because I want to have the fun I used to have in previous seasons, but it just isn't happening. The time investment of learning how to play a new game is seeming less and less daunting.

I miss karthus jungle, or fid jungle, or teemo jungle, or pre-rework GP jungle or Garen jungle... etc. I miss options. I don't like jungle to be defined as "be at this point on the map by this time." This was the wrong way to shake things up and the outcome was PAINFULLY predictable.

edit:
TLDR for you mouth-breathers: my beef is with the pigeon-holing of the jungle in to crab-centric duelists rather than allowing there to be variety in jungle play-styles. Leona went gank-heavy SUCCESSFULLY, but that isn't viable any more.

Here is a video that summarizes my feelings cause judging by the comments you all have reading-comprehension problems...

https://youtu.be/fPLiXiJw0Xg

replies.body: you sure it was because you were a duelist jungler or was it because she was a fucking leona...

Kinda on point. Every now and then RITO puts a random change, that kills more and more niche picks. I had the impression that Leona played around champ weaknesses and proceed to murder laners. In that case she shouln't lose because she was a fucking leona and cannot contest a fucking scuttle crab. Niche off-meta picks are among the most fun and creative ways to enjoy the game and killing them is dumb

You can't expect to try and play anything you want, anywhere you want, and do well with it. In any competent elo, Leona will never be a good jungler, no matter what changes they do to the jungle or her. Early game duelists will destroy her constantly. They will invade her and take all her jungle. Scuttle crab changes have NOTHING to do with how bad something like Leona jungle is.

You are correct in that any champ shouldn't be expected to be doing well, but the point was that that Leona actually succeeded in what she was doing and that would have justified her winning the game as she and her team played better like OP said. Not lose because the other team just happened to have Udyr. She should have lost if she didn't play well.

She didn't play well enough. Her ganks worked because his allies were blind and because she has a lot of CC. That doesn't mean anything. I could play jungle Soraka and walk between lanes and heal up my laners so that they win their lanes. I did well, right? Oh wait, the enemy Graves farms 2 jungles now and has solo killed me 5 times, but hey, I'm supporting my lanes.

It's not black and white. Jungle, and any other role to be honest, covers a huge variety of things that need to be done. Just because Leona got off some ganks doesn't mean anything. She couldn't contest Udyr farming her jungle, which put her behind so much, that eventually Udyr took over. That doesn't mean that Udyr is strong, it means that Leona jungle isn't viable, because the basic thing of her role (contesting, farming and defending her jungle) can't be accomplished by herself.

You gotta realize that ganking as a jungler is a secondary option. Your main win condition as a jungler is to beat the enemy jungler. How? By keeping vision on the map (invading), by stealing their camps to set them behind and also trying to kill them as well. If you can't do those, that's when you resort to ganking. If 1v1ing the enemy jungler is risky, or your champ can't do it, that's when you focus more on ganking. That said, you still need to at least be able to have some farming power in the jungle. Amumu is weak in duels, but he can at least clear camps quite fast, and can gank well. Leona can't clear camps at all, which means that she can't invade the enemy and can't even 1v1 either.

>My team played terribly early: ignored Leona's telegraphed pathing and even the wards she was walking through, dying to her ganks repeatedly.

I mean sounds like the Leona wasn't doing half bad. Less clear but plays like a Sejuani jungler?
jg Leona is inferior to Amumu in almost every way while not being too much different.

She was doing bad. Her clear is atrocious, which makes it so that the enemy jungler essentially gets 2 jungles to clear and her ganks aren't that good either, except if she shows up in lane from behind. OP said that the laners ignored her obvious pathing and wards, so that's why they died.
Why were you downvoted? You are literally 100% correct.

Well, classic example of these boards. Most people here think the game is simple. "Leona ganked successfully twice, she must win the game", but they can't grasp the concept of having to do so much more than just ganking.
I understand wanting variety and all, but I think more people would be pissed if things like team comps didn’t mean shit at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Jamaree,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-05-23T00:35:13.287+0000)
>
> I understand wanting variety and all, but I think more people would be pissed if things like team comps didn’t mean shit at all.

And at the same time, as a PVP game progresses through its life... people who want to win the most will pick whatever is best at the time.


Exception is like 1 tricks, but they practice that single champ so much that it really negates the need for top meta picks

> [{quoted}](name=Too Unlucky,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T00:39:42.318+0000)
>
> And at the same time, as a PVP game progresses through its life... people who want to win the most will pick whatever is best at the time.
> 
> 
> Exception is like 1 tricks, but they practice that single champ so much that it really negates the need for top meta picks

This will never not be a thing in literally every and any capacity.

There isn’t a single pvp game in the world where this isn’t a thing.

Side note, also, until high Diamond, picks don’t mean that much anyway, with enough work and dedication, you can take even the most shit champion to Diamond.
Aatrox mains are scary.

> [{quoted}](name=SpecterVonBaren,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2018-05-23T01:50:49.057+0000)
>
> Aatrox mains are scary.

Mains of any kind are scary, those people who stick with a champion through thick and thin.

Once got absolutely dumpstered by a Kindred, it was horrifying.
Old-school Yorick mains- all 5 of them- that was some scary stuff. You didn't dare fight him 1v1 and even 1v2 was dicey.

> [{quoted}](name=Jamaree,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T00:44:07.635+0000)
>
> This will never not be a thing in literally every and any capacity.
> 
> There isn’t a single pvp game in the world where this isn’t a thing.
> 
> Side note, also, until high Diamond, picks don’t mean that much anyway, with enough work and dedication, you can take even the most shit champion to Diamond.

Yep, and its scary how many people think you can just "balance" a pvp game like it's nothing...

>This will never not be a thing in literally every and any capacity.

Yes. Meta literally means "most effective tactic available."
That's not what meta means, that's just a coincidental acronym that's been popularized and makes it easier to remember the origin. Meta refers to metagaming, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metagaming
Correct me if I'm wrong. But from my understanding of the first couple lines'metagaming' would be something like ghosting. Going beyond the rules to gain an advantage.
That would be one negative use of metagaming, sure, but it's not the entirety of metagaming (fortunately).

Wait a second it's almost like you chose a strong meta jungler into a borderline troll pick and won because you could actually fight her? Ever heard of a team comp? lol. 

Maybe it's just my Dota days but you shouldn't be able to jut brute force win with every comp. you can have 5 gods but if they're all AD and enemy buys armor that shouldn't matter. If you and your duo are mechanical masters of Ezreal and Karma that doesn't mean you shouldn't lose to a healing/CC lane like soraka and Jhin just because you're good. If one sides champs are good into anothers that's just how it works out. 

Maybe if the game was more comp reliant there'd be less one tricks claiming they're good and less smurfs brute forcing wins by spamming Akali in silver.

>you can have 5 gods but if they're all AD and enemy buys armor that shouldn't matter.

funny that you would mention this in season 8 ...
Just make a balanced game with hard counters. This way there is no such thing as wining cuz of better picks but team comp still matters.

> [{quoted}](name=Shazzbot69,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-05-23T01:59:51.348+0000)
>
> Just make a balanced game with hard counters. This way there is no such thing as wining cuz of better picks but team comp still matters.

You do realize it's impossible to truly balance a game where different people do different things right?

> [{quoted}](name=Too Unlucky,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-05-23T02:16:25.731+0000)
>
> You do realize it's impossible to truly balance a game where different people do different things right?

Just because you cannot truely balance a game, that doesn't mean what league does is ok.

> [{quoted}](name=Shazzbot69,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T02:18:19.244+0000)
>
> Just because you cannot truely balance a game, that doesn't mean what league does is ok.

Just because it's not ok, doesn't mean you can cry "balance it" without giving actual solutions that isn't biased like half of league players do.

> [{quoted}](name=Too Unlucky,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T02:22:28.998+0000)
>
> Just because it's not ok, doesn't mean you can cry "balance it" without giving actual solutions that isn't biased like half of league players do.

yes, because Riot is paying me the big bucks to balance their game.

> [{quoted}](name=Shazzbot69,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=00040000000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T02:26:54.586+0000)
>
> yes, because Riot is paying me the big bucks to balance their game.

Bad excuse, don't cry for balance if you won't honestly tell riot what needs to be balanced and give reasoning for it.

I mean... it is kind of a perfect excuse.

First, don't work for free.

Second, there is no guarantee that Riot is going to listen to you, me, or anyone else.  Whining is low effort, sure... but working your ass off as an unpaid game dev is a ton of effort with little (if you are lucky) to no payout.
So you say you wanna have a voice but want to  be payed for it ?

> [{quoted}](name=jameswoods420,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=000400000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-05-23T03:03:57.329+0000)
>
> So you say you wanna have a voice but want to  be payed for it ?

I'm saying that it should not be up to the community to do riot's job for them. Just because I don't know how to balance the game, that doesn't mean I can't point out how unbalanced the game is.

> [{quoted}](name=Shazzbot69,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=0004000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-05-23T03:15:51.586+0000)
>
> I'm saying that it should not be up to the community to do riot's job for them. Just because I don't know how to balance the game, that doesn't mean I can't point out how unbalanced the game is.

I think it is impossible to balance this game. I think it would be wise to stop creating new champs and work on the kits of current champs.

> [{quoted}](name=Tÿr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=00040000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-05-23T18:16:48.902+0000)
>
> I think it is impossible to balance this game. I think it would be wise to stop creating new champs and work on the kits of current champs.

At the very least they need to slow down with the new characters

I know it can feel like shit, knowing you won just because you out picked your opponents, but to be honest, that's part of the game, and pretty much always has been. Picking a comp is a skill you must master, just like any other in league

All the people in the comments talking about how League now is so much worse and it feels like shit, riot has no idea what they're doing and they talk about how great league used to be, yet when you look at the boards for seasons 4 and 5 it's the same shit that we are seeing now but only crying about the seasons before this. I guess you just can't make people happy can u

its nothing new in gameplay. lol

i remember when everyone blew up over riot removing solo q. at this point i usually just shrug this stuff off. we've had far worse in the past and people are getting worked up over matches being won due to people making misplays.

I was gonna agree and mention how fun it was to theorycraft off meta builds and how good you felt when you succeeded in creating the perfect combination of runes, masteries, and items (being a big enthusiast in off meta and Teemo jungle), or even if you had an off meta duo lane and made it work, it felt awesome.
Now it's turned into "who is in the top two tiers of champs?", and anyone who isn't in that bracket is destroyed, or those who used to be up there (but isn't a "nerf protected" champ) is nerfed hard and is unable to be played (Sona can't even get to her power spike anymore).
I miss old League.

Wouldn't this be a normal outcome for jg Leona? She picked a really bad champion for the jungle and she got punished for it by a better jg champion, how is that not ok? It's literally like complaining that i got stomped for going support Katarina by a meta support such as Braum. You're also comparing some off meta jungle picks who were possible with a fucking Leona who was never viable jungle.
I can't find this game in your history match.
Leona is one of a few champions that should fucking never be allowed to be a decent jungler.

Wait so, if I understand this correctly, enemy jungler did well early, the lanes did nothing with their leads, you got full reign of the jungle, and you beat her down because you're a deulist and shes a no damage tank? Just, to be clear, thats your complaint? You are upset, because your better scaling team OUTMACROED THE ENEMY and then won. From the sound of it you carreid and made it a 5v4 because of useless laners on the enemy team. Sounds like  the jungle carried because you won your matchup, and extended your lead to your allies. Sounds like a well balanced game to me. Stop trying to get the sympathy upvotes "wah wah deulists are OP wah" its cause they need nerfs if anything, not cause jungle is poorly designed.

I dont see why youre upset.... Leona is my main, and as much fun as a random jungle Leona game could be, Udyr is a very strong invader, and Leona is a hot garbage jungler. Even without the jungle changes, this would have been the expected result.

Are you kidding me? It's a fucking jg LEONA.

Play against a rammus jg that did really well early, but you were able to 1v1 him and destroy him just from taking crabs and invading him. That at least would be an actual jg and not a troll pick like Leona.

I don't agree. You can't expect to just take ANYTHING and do well with it. It's like "oh I'm gonna play Soraka ADC, oh fuck I got destroyed and we lost, Riot's fault for not making Soraka viable as a carry".

There are things viable and there are things unviable. Leona is unviable as a jungler. It doesn't work. People need to understand that it's 2018, not 2013. Everything, every little strategy, every little tip and trick is known. You see a weak early game duelist, like Amumu, Leona, Zac? INVADE them. They literally can do nothing. Things like that were viable back then because nobody would take the time to understand that counter jungling is a thing. Also, jungle monsters were far weaker back then, so anyone would clear the camps.

It's not Riot's fault.
Maybe it's because Leona makes a terrible jungler clear-wise

Look, if you jungle leona, you know you're letting your team down, even if your pathing is glorious and your ganks great.

It's not like she played a slightly off meta jungler, she took a champion that has next to no clear speed, and try to make it jungle, and hey, the cheese was working out ok... then eventually it starts to smell like overripe limberger.  

News, the same can easily happen with jungle Teemo, Alistar, etc

This isn't new.  It's been the case since Season 2.  You try to jungle, you have no clear, you suffer for it, even if your ganks are great.

> [{quoted}](name=jadelink,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iyyBWg1T,comment-id=002d,timestamp=2018-05-24T07:48:43.410+0000)
>
> This isn't new.  It's been the case since Season 2.  You try to jungle, you have no clear, you suffer for it, even if your ganks are great.

Yeah, but before you at least had a choice in viable junglers - you could have a duelist, or you could also play non-duelists with great clear and ganks  (Once again - {{champion:20}} comes to mind.)

Now, forget playing the solo clear gankers - the meta is comprised of duelists and tanks who can survive the duelists only.

Do we really want to see {{champion:141}}{{champion:5}}  {{champion:59}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:164}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:72}}{{champion:154}}  duking it out for the next year to the exclusion of just about everybody else?

It's like the old toplane melee meta went to the jungle instead, and nobody wanted either change.

Most tank jgers (zac included) are weak at the moment.  But tanks in general are weak at the moment.  When was the last time we saw a Maokai or Naut in top lane ?  I cant remember seeing one for ages.  Sej is in a miserable spot too.

I suspect tanks are weak in top and jg alike due to not actually being able to take the bruisers and skirmishers at the moment.  I've certainly had success on early junglers who don't want to duel.  Good pathing has me keep up with them fine.  Though Im not thrilled about jg being determined by mid lane quite so much, thats probably my jg bias.

The nature of the game being so snowbally is favouring assassins and skirmishers a lot at the moment, in both top lane and jg, and sadly I do expect that's going to be worse with the vast extra tank busting power they can access when the new items come to live.   Losing the ability to mitigate crit with Tabi and Randuins is going to mean teams of squishy fighters on both sides, which I don't like, as it tends to mean boring, one sided stomps, where even winning doesn't feel great, as it gets to be a forgone conclusion 12 minutes in.

>    The enemy team PLAYED BETTER but lost because we PICKED &quot;BETTER&quot; CHAMPS.


Yup. Pick2win > Play2win. That's what this game has become.
